alert.note: Alert for Grant; West Otter Tail; Wilkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 22 at 9:36PM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of west central Minnesota and southeast North Dakota. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until noon CST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 PM CST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Accumulating snow and blowing snow will combine to create very difficult to impossible travel conditions. Travel will be life-threatening to those stranded due to dangerous wind chills and significant drifting. The heaviest snowfall totals will occur along the tri-state area, increasing as you progress southward.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
